item.title: Recognizing dependencies
item.description: From the Chapter 3, Managing Dependencies, from the book Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby, by Sandi Metz: An object has a dependency when it knows: The name of another class. […] The name of a message that it intends to send to someone other than self. […] The arguments that a message requires. […] The order of those arguments. […] If an object knows any of these facts about another object, it has dependencies to the other.
